sen.j: 九品寺（くほんじ）は、奈良県御所市楢原にある浄土宗の寺院。
sen.e: Kuhon-ji Temple is a temple of the Jodo sect located in Narahara, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
Kuhon-ji Temple is a temple of the Jodo sect located in Narahara, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
Kuhon-ji Temple is a temple of the Jodo sect located in Narahara, Gose City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は戒那山（かいなさん）。
sen.e: The sango (the temple's title) is Kainasan.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix) is Kainasan.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix) is Kainasan.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
The principal image is Amida Nyorai.
History
History
History

sen.j: この寺の創建年代等については不詳であるが、奈良時代の僧行基によって創建されたと伝えられる。
sen.e: The year of the foundation of the temple is unknown, however, it is said to have been founded by Gyoki, a priest of the Nara Period.
The year of the foundation of the temple is unknown, however, it is said to have been founded by Gyoki, a priest of the Nara Period.
The year of the foundation of the temple is unknown, however, it is said to have been founded by Gyoki, a priest of the Nara Period.

sen.j: 中世には御所城主楢原氏の菩提所であった。
sen.e: In the Medieval Period, it was the family temple of the lord of Gose Castle, of the Narahara clan.
In the Medieval Period, it was the family temple of the lord of Gose Castle, of the Narahara clan.
In the Medieval Period, it was the family temple of the lord of Gose Castle, of the Narahara clan.

sen.j: 永禄年間（1558年～1570年）観誉弘誓によって現在の浄土宗に改められた。
sen.e: During 1558-1570, it was changed to the current Jodo sect by 観誉弘誓.
sen.cmt: 「観誉弘誓」の読み方、および、「改められた」の具体的な意味がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: During 1558-1570, it was converted to the current Jodo sect by 観誉弘誓.
During 1558-1570, it was converted to the current Jodo sect by Kanyo Guzei.
sen.cmt: 浄土宗によれば観誉はかんよと読むようです。（出典：http://www.jodo.or.jp/naruhodo/event/index18.html）、弘誓はぐぜいと読むようです（出典：大辞泉）。
